Anonymous Fri 06 Apr 2018 01:45:17 No.15001628 Report
Quoted By: >>15001965
>>15001207
-Coughing Fit

you got it, I've been doing worldbuilding and making notes in my spare time to weave some of that exploratory flavor into the story.

The issue I have with in-thread world building is it takes the fun of discovery out of it when it's not revealed through the story proper. If I need help with that sort of thing, I'll ask for it, and likely I'll ask for that from another writefag across pastebin in order to minimize spoilering people

Plus when one thread is entirely dominated by the discussion surrounding only a single piece or writer it can stifle the rest of us. I understand everyone got excited with Ret's little free idea power hour stuff, but I would be lying if I didn't find myself getting just the slightest bit jealous that so much attention was levelled at one writefiend, taking up half the thread, when at most I get like 10 (you)s from an update, which seems to be the norm for most writers here.

Anonymous Fri 06 Apr 2018 02:05:27 No.15002011 Report
Quoted By: >>15002079
>>15001844
Now this is just uncalled for. We (we being the other writefags) can't demand an audience, or sway the other anons to give us (You)'s by force besides writing better things.
I agree with the fact that your readers can take over a thread even before or after you start doing your thing, but since multiple people have pointed it out there's hope that they would at least behave. And it's most certainly not you're fault; the only thing you've done is be friendly enough to reciprocate and participate with the audience.
We can't control the thread, but that doesn't mean you need to screw off. Write if you want to write, man. If you're insistent on taking a break from /hmofa/, at least polish what you haven't shown the thread, or brainstorm for something new. Just don't stop writing. Take it from me; when you get used to writing and then stop doing it you'll feel like a bunch of negative shit, including guilty for disappointing people. So don't stop writing, even if you stop updating. That way when you come back, you'll have something to show for it, hyperbolic time chamber style.

>>15001844

Blokfort here.

Just wanted to give my 2 cents (along with everyone else) on thoughts about the whole thing.
Keep writing, we like the stories you bring.

Now about world building... World building is in fact incredibly fun, I have my own (shitty) world that I've been working on for a while now.
But as other Anons have voiced, it has gotten pretty ridiculous. The fact that you need a separate pastebin tab to to hold all the ideas trying to connect every single story your write means it will be one hell oof a MONUMENTAL TASK to try and bring them all together, when the actually fun is through reading "the now" and discovering what happens through reading the story.
All these little things that people have said about "oh Nocten is actually connected to RGB (RBG?), oh Connie's world is actually connected to Nocten as well through wacky rift shenanigans, Nocten first contact with earth, and you can have time stopping dragons hoard coffee beans.

World building is fun, but that's all it is. There's no real substance to it.

Unless you plan on writing a 5000 page book, then I honestly think you should just hide the world building notes you have and try to keep everything separated again.
There's no need for Nocten to have first contact, Subina and Anon have had their story.
There's no need for Connie and Anon to meet RGB. ETC.

I say there's no "need" to, but hey, it's YOUR story. You do you, and keep writing.

Anonymous Fri 06 Apr 2018 03:59:15 No.15004324 Report

>>15004082
Basically, I was thinking that Anon starts off piloting an "Armored Core 3" era mech to begin with, then finds an advanced and stylistically different mech with the wAIfur inside.
Armored Core 3 mechs have thrusters but accelerate slowly but have a humanoid appearance (though in game you can change this with quadruped legs, hover legs, tank treads, arms with fixed weapons instead of hands). Think of a mix between Gundam and Mech Warrior in terms of mobility. Lumbering while walking, but with the thrusters activated become decently mobile.

The mech the protagonist finds is going to be very advanced, capable of hovering in place, indefinite energy supply, sheilds, and a neural interface instead of controls. The wAIfur will help him interface with the machine. Basically, the story will involve trying to uncover the origin of both wAIfur and the machine, and the truth of the setting where everyone lives in.

<Retconned>

...I dunno. I've been thinking about it for a while now. I've seen several good points being made.

Here's what I'm thinking.

The wordbuilding paste? Noncanon. If it's not explicitly or implicitly mentioned in one of the one offs or interactives, consider it likely noncanon. I'm not deleting it altogether, but I am retconning many things for the sake of making the world easier to hold together.

Nocten will still contact Earth eventually. The Otherworld is still tied to the Human World somehow. Coyote and Capra still manifest in the mortal realm for their own reasons, but I think I'll leave the Divination on the drawing board for the time being. Introducing a whole pantheon is going to make things considerably harder to work with.

The timeline is still going to be mostly accurate. I don't think anything currently listed contradicts my current plans.

Thank you to all the anons who contributed to the world building paste. Sorry if this retcon is disappointing, but I feel it's for the best.

To /hmofa/ and my fellow writers, sorry again for all the inconvenience. I'm gonna take the night off on Connie.
